reviews.content: N/A
Close today but not posted any notice anywhere (Facebook & Google). Wasted my time.

We had a great time visiting the Natural Nest in Newark. The facility is well kept and there are plenty of activities to range different ages. AHK has only ever played at one other in-door play park, and this one was unmatched. There are so many toys for her age, and height- she's TINY! Calming music streams through the speakers as you enjoy your play session. I loved that they offered food and beverages in the case you need one. There's an ample amount of room to store your belongings. They even have high chairs if you need to feed your little ones, and shared clogs so you don't have to enter the bathroom in just your socks!

The only negative I have to say about this particular location is the lack of steps on the play gym. There is ramp with grip, but it's pretty steep and tough to climb while guiding a small toddler. The only other option is a climbing wall, which again, not super easy to navigate to the top with your child.

We don't live in DE, but I would definitely recommend Natural Nest to others in the future!
My grandson had his 1st birthday party at Natural Nest. All the kids enjoyed themselves and it was a nice atmosphere.
Loved the place itself, the concept and the staff were amazing. Will definitely be back when we’re in the area
N/A

Booked for a birthday party and as other reviews have said it left a lot to be desired. It was hard to tell what the place actually looked like from the pictures online. Was not the space I was expecting, but nice. There was no cafe from what I could tell, even though that’s what was advertised. Even as a SAHM the hours are very minimal. We did book a DIY party but I expected at least a little help from the staff.. the only part they DID help with was to charge people for socks and then remind us when it was time to leave. Overall not a welcoming experience and I have not taken my child back but am considering going to the Middletown location which has better reviews.

The employees at this location are consistently unaware of their surroundings. They allow their own children to run amuck in the facility, they do not treat visitors with kindness, and they seem to ignore any needs that arise. The bathroom had no paper towels or toilet paper, a big kid was playing on the slide and the entire structure swayed with their weight, the employees child was running around without a shirt…
Just consistently disappointing. I would not recommend either of the locations to anyone.

I wanted to love this facility, but unfortunately, my experience left a lot to be desired.

We booked a last-minute DIY party, and while I appreciated their flexibility with scheduling, the turnaround time on the details was understandably short. I was asked to provide an estimated number of children, and I was told it didn’t need to be exact—just so they could ensure enough seating.

However, on the day of the party, I was told I had to pay for the number I initially estimated.
I explained that I planned to pay at the end, once I had a final headcount. When the party ended, I again explained that fewer children attended than expected. Despite this, I was told the owner insisted I still pay for the original number, which felt unfair and inflexible.

We also paid extra for the bubble machine, which turned out to be a complete nightmare.
Within 3–4 minutes, the first child slipped and fell due to the slippery puddles the bubbles created. I asked if the charge could be removed, as it created a safety hazard. The staff member attempted to clean it with a paper towel, which only made the mess worse. She said she would ask about the charge, but I was ultimately told I still had to pay. I then asked if we could at least move the machine to a safer location, since I was being charged for it.

When I asked about resolving the billing issue, I was told to message someone, which I did.
Unfortunately, the person who responded directed me back to the same individual at the facility who had already said she couldn’t help me. It felt like I was being passed around without any resolution.

To add to the frustration, our trash can was full, and I had to ask for another bag. While the young lady helping us was friendly and clearly doing her best, I feel that her supervisor failed both her and me.

I really wanted this to be a great experience, but it ended up being more stressful than joyful.
Awesome experience ! Very clean and fun
Great place to go with little kids to play. Very relaxing atmosphere and kind helpful staff. We love it here!

Will go again. My 20 month old daughter loved it. Nice chill space for adults but lots to see and do for the kids. It’s easy to keep an eye on them. The music class was amazing too. Can’t wait to come back!

We've been to this location multiple times for classes, events and open play. Watching from their soft opening until now, you can see how much effort and work they've been putting into the facility. My son loved the playwords classes, the bluey event, holiday pizza party event and going for open play. The owner and her family are friendly and engaging.

I was genuinely excited for Play Nest Café in Newark to open, as it’s much closer to me than the Middletown location. However, after today’s experience, I’d rather make the drive to Middletown, where the new licensed owner provides exceptional customer service. She’s attentive, passionate about her role, and goes above and beyond to ensure all families feel welcomed. Her love for what she does is clear—every child is treated fairly, and every parent feels included. That kind of atmosphere is what makes a business thrive.

Unfortunately, Newark’s location has consistently fallen short of those standards for me. Today marked the third chance I gave this location to change my perspective, but it was yet another disappointing experience. I understand that we all have off days, especially as moms, but the consistent lack of effort to create a welcoming environment here speaks volumes.

When my son and I arrived, the atmosphere was uninviting from the start. My son, full of excitement, was quickly met with situations that felt dismissive and unfair. Another child began snatching toys from him, and while her mother was distracted, the person in charge saw it all unfold yet chose to intervene only in favor of the other child. At one point, when my son happily tried to engage with the person in charge’s child, she physically pulled her child away from him, leaving my son visibly saddened. The lack of acknowledgment or effort to include us left me feeling incredibly uncomfortable.

In contrast, my experience at Middletown’s Play Nest Café has always been positive, thanks to the owner’s genuine care for families and her inclusive approach. Today’s experience reinforced the importance of hiring staff who align with a business’s values and understand how to make families feel valued. Sadly, this hasn’t been my experience at Newark.

As much as I love supporting small businesses, I cannot continue to spend my money at a location where I feel unwelcome and discriminated against, nor will I subject my son to such treatment. While the space is aesthetically pleasing, the experience simply doesn’t reflect the environment it should. If you value fairness, inclusion, and genuine customer service, I cannot recommend the Newark location.

I got there at 12:00 pm exact and i left within 20 minutes due to how uncomfortable, depressing etc is was .

I don’t typically write reviews, but I felt compelled to share my experience. Today, my wife took our son to this location, and unfortunately, the staff member in charge made them feel unwelcome and uncomfortable throughout their visit. This individual repeatedly gave them unpleasant looks and displayed discriminatory behavior.

Additionally, there were children being rude to my son, taking all the toys from him, yet the staff member failed to address the situation or remind the children that the toys are for everyone to share.

We usually visit the Middletown location, where the service is exceptional, and the atmosphere is always welcoming. Unfortunately, this is the second time we’ve had a negative experience at this particular location, which is why I’m writing this review. I do not recommend bringing your children here due to the poor service.

I’ve only been here once and while my kids loved it they opened late the day that I went. I got there at 9:05 (they open at 9) and waited until 9:10 still no one there so I ran to Wawa next door and by the time I got back they opened. The same thing happened today (11/20) and I waited out in the parking lot until 9:20 and still not open.

My nieces  ( 1 & 2 years old ) had the best time ever playing today it was super cute play area very clean relaxing vibe that I myself enjoyed I didn’t think they would last two hours but they enjoyed them self so much the time snuck up on us very reasonably priced and very friendly staff i definitely will be spreading the word about this location and I most definitely will be returning thank you very much for the pleasant experience 🫶🏽
Family business - great for a rainy day. Very peaceful and fun!
Love this place.  Always something new to do    Healthful snacks. The owner so personal
We had great fun at the cafe. Definitely coming back

I have taken my 3 year old to outside parks, sky zone, urban air and she always loses interest fast. But here she played the entire time without break and was sad when we had to leave. I was super impressed with how organized everything was, the supplies of toys and how calm and chill it was. Plenty of seating for parents to sit and watch, and just enjoy watching their child play. Friendly staff too that came out often to organize all the toys so parents could focus on their kids. Absolutely love this place now and will definitely be back.
N/A

The blinds and the windows were extremely dusty and dirty (like very) and the sponge pit was dusty also- as soon as my son jumped in it I could see lots of dust just spreading in the air. Honestly, especially for  $16 I really expected a clean facility for my little one to play in. The main lady who greeted us was very sweet. The place itself is definitely much smaller than i imagined and felt a little underwhelming.
The whole family loves this place!}

reviews.content:
Great for younger kids. Games were ridiculously expensive.
Should have some type of food. Drinks and chips very expensive.

This place is a fun destination, the lot is much bigger than most other places, it's well laid out, and there are plenty of activities to enjoy. There’s lots of space, so if there are many kids, everyone can spread out pretty well, but you do need to keep an eye on your children. There are some height restrictions on certain attractions, but the staff rarely enforces them, and honestly, they seem miserable and bothered if you ask them questions. The staff's attitude can vary, with some areas being closed off, but others open, though nothing really prevents anyone from climbing on certain equipment. So, supervision is important. The video games are a bit overpriced, so you can burn through money quickly. Overall, I recommend the place except for the high prices on gaming. The only downside is the staff on the floor. They seem unhappy and not very attentive to the kids. The front staff is friendly and helpful when buying tickets. As long as you're watching your kids and staying alert, it’s not a bad place to visit.
Kids loved it great place.  Wish they had a membership but is what it is.

Got my shoes stolen leaving them in the shoe box don’t do it to yourself, bring a book bag and put ya shoes and belongings in there. I complained and all they could do is give me a free voucher to come back. They have no lockers and don’t plan on getting any from my knowledge.

Came here a few weeks ago with my sister. There is so much stuff to do for adults and kids. Their is trampolines, ball pits, foam pits, obstacle courses, rock climbing, slides, tube slide with raft, balls to bounce around in I think they r called zorb balls not sure but those r cool as hell. All the workers appear to be high schoolers and they r all really nice and helpful. The price for both me and my sister to come here was 50$ for 90 minutes of all access play except for arcade games which r their own payment. Their was a lot of kids here when we came because their was some birthday parties but since the place is an old K-MART it’s really big inside and plenty of room to move around it don’t feel crowded at all. Honestly I was shocked by the cheap price of only 50$ and theirs so much stuff to do. I went to sky zone with my sister last year and it was like 80-90$ for 90 minutes and socks and there wasn’t hardly that much to do . This place is awesome I highly recommend checking it out.

I attended my niece's birthday party there. The party room was nice including the host with cubbies for shoes and clothes. It looks like a grand time for those under 12: ball pits, slides, trampolines, rock climbing walls and more. It is loud and can be a sensory overload.
Took my 3 year old for his birthday. Had a blast will definitely be back.
Understaffed this time, a number of attractions were closed and no help when needed.  Kids had a great time, and love it there.  A nice workout while having fun.

The kids working are very friendly, they tend to your needs and interact with the children. Except there was a older women name Kate and she seemed very rude and condescending. Maybe it was a bad day but it wasn't appreciated.

When we walked in we were in aawww of the place. Very colorful bright and inviting. Large trampoline area with ton of things to do.

We got there right when they open. We were 2nd ones there. The back corner trampoline had candy wrappers on it so the night before it wasn't cleaned. Not a big deal

Loved that you can jump off the walls on the trampolines and do tricks. Long jump pads, tubing slides, ball pits. We were loving it UNTIL....

We went to play games. We swiped the game card twice and it took the credits bu game didn't work. I told the ONLY worker there and she pulls up our transactions. She tells me it swiped but didnt take our points. I said no, it took our points but the zero you see was the tickets from playing the game. After 5 mins she rudly said well I can come with you and use the store card but I cant credit your card. That's fine. She came over to the machine I told her wasn't working and she said "watch"! She swiped the store card and IT DIDNT WORK! my point proven.

She swipped the store card twice amd let us be. Fast fwd an hour, couple more employeedls came in. They opened hp the sections that you needed an employee (rope course, climbing tower, tubing). We're ready to leave so we missed out on those activities so plan you timing if you go and want to do those). We went to cash out the points. She literally ignored us at the counter. This place is dead at the counter. The cashier rolled her eyes at this employee and came over to help us.

Come to find out she was the manager that was so rude. This matches the other reviews too. We won't be back.

We had a blast. There was so much for the kids to do it seem like everyone was there to have fun and get along. There was nothing negative about this experience. I highly recommend it and I can’t wait to take my kids to do it again. I think it works for all ages
Good place for the kids to get some energy out.  Clean and with a variety of activities and games for them to have fun.  If you have smaller kids, parents can join with the kids.

The only thing we didn’t like was that set up and take down were part of our two hours in the room. Took away time from parents and kids, since the last 20 minutes were spent loading the car.

Twenty Two year olds we’re making two year-old toddlers fly and he made me fly too employee snapped at my cousins and telling us to leave and to my little sister and I almost drowned in the foam pit a 25 year old went on the zip line. She jumped off of it and she broke the zip line. Like how could you let a 25-year-old get on the zip line even though that’s for kids and two year old fly and doing backflips on the bounty trampolines that’s just unacceptable sky zone is much more funner than this place and the reason why I gave this to stars is because in the middle of the dodgeball arena there is a trampoline that can almost break your back This was the worst experience ever. It was only like 30 minutes long because the employees told us to leave, and some girl went up to my cousins and my cousin said I’ll get the next one, but then the girl said girls no we’re getting the next one cause you got the last one like what the heck I will never go to this placeAGAIN!!!! the pizza was good though, and some arcades didn’t even work and this is why I’ll never go to fun city again

So if you have a kid under 5. Stay near at all times. Overall. Fantastic place. 10 stars. And yes the big chicken cheese steak is banging. Bing bong boom you wouldn't understand
This place is huge! Lots of space and activities for kids of all ages! Huge ball area. Lots of trampolines and slides. Separate wall climbing area and a zip line walk. Fun for the whole family!

This place is HUGE! We went on a weeknight, $26 for 1.5hrs of fun. We've been to so many indoor fun parks and cannot believe how much there was to do here, including the "tube sled" in the picture. Definitely geared towards 6/7+ but so worth a visit!

Very cool place. They have a zip line obstacle course. Trampoline park, dodgeball area foam pits, and 2 small half court basketball trampoline areas. They do birthday parties, but they do not serve food.
Awesome place for kids
very clean and fun activities. will come back soon!
Fist time here today and I love this place! It’s so clean and fun. My kids (8&2) smiled the entire time. We will be back and I will be telling all my friends with kids!

The first thing I’d like to mention is the size.
This place is massive and not for the faint hearted!
There is so much to do but this is not an environment for small children. I would recommend 4+ for the safest and most fun experience.

Pros:
This place is PERFECT to get your kids energy out!
There is a huge indoor climbing playground/ball pit with slides & rock climbing.
There are obstacle course foam pits and regular foam pits.
There are trampoline sections throughout and even basketball trampoline!
There is a separate rock climbing area and an indoor tubing slide.
There’s also a full ropes course & bumper ball!
Lastly, they have a large video game arcade area for an additional price.

Cons:
There are activities that require a height of 42’ but there were zero attendants enforcing this policy.
There were also zero attendants enforcing age requirements or the one person/trampoline policy they had posted throughout the facility.
This place is very loud. Anyone with sensory processing concerns will most likely be overwhelmed here.

All in all, I would recommend FunCity but you must be alert and on top of your child at all times.
My child had an absolute blast but I saved a 3 year old that couldn’t pull herself out of the ball pit and watched many other safety violations during our 1.5 hour visit.
I would have given them 5 stars if there was more emphasis on safety.

I hosted a birthday party for my 5 year old last weekend… let me just say JUSTIN was INCREDIBLE. Anything I needed, any questions, EVERYTHING he was on it. The facility was very clean and well maintained. There is a very wide selection of activities for all ages, even the adults had a blast! Over all my daughter was very happy!
We had a blast. It was something for all ages to enjoy.
My daughter and her friend loved the interaction and fun with high level climbing and zip lining.

I took my boys (9, 11, 13 & 14) and they all had a blast. The only issue is the food options. They’re nonexistent, except for chips and drinks. Oh and the ice cream vending machine. We did see pizza but they were delivered, I believe, and were for the many birthday parties that were there (by the way those rooms are kind of small). Regardless, we will be returning often because they love it here.

Keep a close eye on young children, especially on Saturday evenings. Some older kids were seen hitting younger ones in a way that seemed intentional rather than playful, which could be dangerous.

The Zipline attendant was annoyed that my daughter changed her mind and did t want to proceed.

Then I turn around and there’s a kid stuck hanging on the Zipline, thankfully a staff came with a ladder to help. Some kids didn’t meet the height requirement but were still allowed on.

Additionally, the air circulation in the building needs improvement. When it’s crowded, the smell becomes unpleasant.

It’s a fun place, kids were happy, but watch your child closely for their safety.

We took our daughter to FunCity today for the first time and had a good experience there. The place is fantastic and has tons of different things to do for all ages.

It would be nice to have more seating in different areas since the kids are always on the go and some parents would want to keep tabs on them. We drove an hour to bring my son here for his birthday. He was ecstatic and we had a great time for the first hour. My son got his foot stuck in one of the rope nets, no big deal, but he did need some help getting untangled. Not only was this extremely unprofessional of a “child friendly” facility, but also ruined the whole experience for my son and his siblings who also heard this interaction. reviews.content: Overall, the actual facility was fine, but I booked a party for 18. I was coming from out of town and arrived at 1:45 PM. The party was going to start at 2 PM. The room was empty so I asked if I could put this large sheet cake I was carrying in the room on the table. I was told no! I even indicated the room was empty. I just wanted to set this cake down and I would leave the room. I was told no. I brought a four year-old with me who wanted to start playing, 10 minutes early and they told me I had to pay an extra 21.99.  I stated that I had a party which they knew for $575 so couldn't they let my four year-old jump 10 minutes early. They said no. The rudest of the staff was a kid named Ben. He looked like he was about 12, but I assume he was 16. If my boys ever spoke to me the way this boy spoke to me they would've been grounded for life. I could give many examples but I won't. I will say the party was to end at 3:45 PM which I was fully aware and plan to be out of the room by then because I did not know if they had another party beginning at four. At 3:30 Ben comes in and informs me very rudely if I don't get out and that's a direct quote by 345 he was going to charge me for an additional hour for the party room and kids. There were two other girls there both Looked like they were 16. I only dealt with one other and she was just as rude.. I see when I arrived Because I was annoyed, they wouldn't let me set the cake down and the manager appeared from the back room. She said that I could go ahead and put the cake down in the room and then promptly left and I never saw her again.

The maintenance is not up-kept at all. My daughter is 3, and was jumping on the kids only section. She took a step on one of the pads and fell through, landing on the ground which was not padded at all. The padding has Velcro, which wasn’t attached and had a spring missing so she fell completely to the ground…back of her neck is scratched & swollen, along with her shoulder and a  bruise on her rib area. I know it’s a jump park and accidents happen but this is just ridiculous.

My 3 kids and I truly enjoyed the time we had they have arcade games and very clean bathrooms the music is always kid friendly. They have snacks and drinks at a reasonable price! The employees are very kind and always on top of my requests.
To whoever is sending bad reviews, stop bitching and just enjoy the trampoline park

Horrible dirty disgusting place with many safety issues.  The inflatable obstacles course did not have enough density to it, when my kids step on it there foot went to the floor. The bathrooms are dirty with  have uneven floors that you can trip on. The ball bit had many broken balls. The one tube made of netting that's high off the ground was broken , missing screws had holes in it. Many holes in play equipment, tape holding things together. We left after 20 minutes. Waste of money and time. I wish I would have done a charge back on my card but forgot and now too much time has passed.

Young, white male, brunette aka Mr. Ruin all children fun - did exactly that. We usually visit twice a week with our Funfull membership and invite our friends to come too. Well not when he’s following us around. Chill out and let kids have safe, happy, fun! Cancelled membership and will not be returning. You need to vet kind, playful, happy staff.

I would give zero stars but that's not even am option!

The facility is disgusting, lacking cleanliness.

The top of the play area is NOT netted and there is a 10+ foot drop.

The balls in ball pit were mostly broken and hurt my childrens feet. The netting was too big in the 2nd floor of the play area causing my child to fall in and get stuck. The trampolines spring covers were broken causing my child to trip.

When staff were notified they acted as if I was lying. I fully intend on disputing the $31 charge !! The place is a law suit and a death trap!

Tape was holding the slide together, dirty floors. Screws coming undone IN the slides. I will NEVER return when I asked for a manager apparently no one working there knew who the manager is. Hopefully this gets back to them and changes are made.

Glad there is something close and affordable for our kids physically active.

My 7 year one had fun- that’s the plus. But this facility looks run down. Broken floor tiles, worn padding on the playground equipment, broken netting. It took three tries to get the correct WiFi password but it still had an error and you can’t get on the internet. One out of three bathroom stalls had toilet paper. There was water all over the bathroom floor. The whole place felt dirty and not well kept. We tried it a second time. Half way through the kids play time we were told we had to have their brand of play sock on. This wasn’t the case on our first visit nor when we entered. We left. We will not be back. We’re also reporting several safety issues to the attorney general's office as there is not netting to prevent children from getting on top of the equipment more than 10 feet off the ground. This place is dirty and not safe.

The two ladies at the check in desk were very nice and attentive. They went out of their way to assist me with my needs. I love the variety of food and snacks they have to offer. The music is equally appropriate for children and adults; very fun and entertaining. The only reason I didn’t give full five stars is because the section where the ball pit is and the climbing area with tunnels could use a nice cleaning. It would be helpful to maybe do a quick wipe down of that area every hour. Everything else was really nice along with excellent service.

Many previous reviews have discussed the lack of cleanliness and professionalism at this business. So my review will speak to the safety concerns I observed while my two kids were playing at the playground.

1. Lack of netting above equipment. All major overhead areas of an indoor playground need to have fire and rip resistant netting to keep children from climbing over the sides of the equipment and suffering injury and death from a fall. Flyover park has a lack of this netting in any of their equipment that is above ten feet high. This is a direct violation of the ASTM industry standards, the group who licenses indoor playgrounds such as "Flyover Fun Park". Attached photos show the lack of netting where it needs to be.

2. Lack of staffing for a playground of this size. When we were there, I observed four staff. One was in training, and one was behind the concession stand. I would also imagine this is what is causing the lack of cleanliness in the facility. Having this few staff means that the playground can't be correctly supervised and safety issues can't/ won't be addressed. At minimum, there should be six staff with two who are focused exclusively on children's safety. When I asked to speak to a manager, I was told there wasn't one on site. This begs the question, who is in charge?

3. Lack of public water: My kids were thirsty and I asked about a water fountain. I was told they didn't have one, and to buy a bottle of water. I understand this is a business, but profiting off thirsty children who are forced to pay for water seems a horrible way to make money.

Seeing the recent negative reviews shows a lack of caring about customers, but I would have hoped Flyover would care about keeping kids safe. Clearly this is not the case.

Who ever took over management is horrible. The facility looks dirty and unkept.
Horrible customer service and inexperienced staff working. They do no allow outside food, which is ridiculous. Come to find out they order food from outside. The two “acting Managers”were rude and threatening. Very Low class and inexperienced people who do not represent the business well.

Update* I did speak to the owner. He was very respectful and apologetic. And even offered compensation. I can appreciate that.

I booked this place for my son's birthday party, if you want your kids to stay hydrated, forget it. The drinks you pay for in the party package will not come out until the food comes which is after the hour of play time. You are not allowed to bring your own water in, I was told I had to take it back out to the car. There are no water fountains to use either and they do not provide courtesy waters for parties. They do this so you'll buy the $1/bottle water,  as a host that can add up if you are buying water for the whole party. I ended up taking the kids out to the car in groups so they could drink water at the car.

Also, if you book a party room, you are not allowed to utilize the party room until after the first hour, when the food gets there. I booked it 4-6 and was told I had to leave the room until 5. Do not and I repeat DO NOT since on the bench outside the room, it is wobbly, my father-in-law almost busted himself falling off it.

Furthermore, do not talk to your friends at the party about the issues you are having with the party, the manager, Lynn Duphily, gets really mad and immature (mockingly immature) and will kick you out. I'm glad I got my refund and they didn't get an ounce of my money. To get the refund was an event in itself. After we packed everything up and everyone is waiting in the car, I went to get my refund receipt and was told "You'll get your refund whenever she is ready to give it to you". We left and had an amazing party elsewhere.
Fun place, something for all kids. Get there early very busy place. Lots of room inside.
Good time and clean every time we come. Staff is friendly
We love to come here, but I am really getting annoyed of the guy who keep asking for $20 at the parking lot. I don’t mind helping though, I just don’t have $20 every day.

This is the second party we had at fly over. The first one was a disaster but I was giving them grace -2 years ago. So we tried again. Nothing has changed. I called a weeks ahead to add more pizza and asked to bring in fruit tray. The lady on phone said yes . When we got to the place they told me we are not suppose to bring food. The lady on the phone also said to come 5 minutes early to decorate. So we did and they then informed me that we could t get into the room til “3” when the pizza comes . They did let us in the room 30 minutes early to decorate. The pizza came 25 minutes late and then they were very rude at telling us to leave the room because the other party was here . We let them know the pizza was 23 minutes late and that’s why we were late leaving the too . They do not give themselves enough buffer room for pizza being late and not enough time for families to decorate. No kid wants plain paper plates ,napkins at a party. Glad we brought our own decorations.  Will not be going back- it’s a circus -lack of communication
Had a nice day with the kids. Small trampoline area. This is fit for kids 8 and under.
N/A

Super fun place and pretty clean. Not very crowded

Hosted my daughter’s birthday party here today and they had a blast.  I think the employees communication is lacking because we were told we could bring in outside food and drinks by one employee but were told the complete opposite at the party and their answer was , “ Well that employee isn’t here today, you should’ve called again today before you came!”  *(Head scratch)* otherwise it was great for rhe kids!
Cool place a bit expensive to bring 3 kids just for a couple hours of playing. Nice staff. Clean Place

Great place to play! Not a super big place, but a little something of everything. Definitely will return when in the area!

I had my daughters 10th birthday here. I made it in very short notice and possibly the team didn't even know we were coming because I had sent emails trying to get information and to ask to update the party number count. No one gave us any direction about how the party was to go, just you are basically just renting the room and basic table covers plain paper plates and only forks and nothing was done beforehand thank goodness we had our own decorations.  We had 15 kids in our party that only accounted for 8 but we were the only ones there and plenty of staff who could have assisted in making things more fun for kids with direction and interaction.  You work at fun park, have fun come on! In the end it just seems no one was prepared for us and seems it would have been better to just have all our friends come without paying the extra money for the room. They did say we may could be on their commercial which would make the kids extra happy so I guess thats all that matters right? The kids had fun but wanted more time.

when I went with my friend we all had so much fun

This place is a disaster. We booked a birthday party here and we’re not given access to the room until almost 35 minutes after the beginning of the party. The woman who said she was the manager then tried to charge us for socks despite the fact we paid to have a party for 12 kids. After that I basically had to beg for them to bring pizza in for the kids to eat. There has to be nicer places than this if you’re looking for somewhere to have a birthday party for your kid.

We aren't familiar with the area. When researching it, it appeared to have a lot more trampolines and jumping opportunities.

Our group had 13 and 10 year old, it was more appropriate for younger.
They also had a small arcade.
One hour session more than enough .

Prices are reasonable for everything.

The floors of needed a good cleaning and in the back of the jumping portions were left over materials, tools, and a ladder.
The public could have easily caused trouble with the tools.

Staff was inattentive to surroundings, but small very young crowd there wasn't any reason to have strict observations.

All in all if my kids were younger , we would go back .

The place was great and looked like new once it opened up... now it looks like they don't add money into their bussiness to fix broken parts or replace ropes or the sponges.

This place is okay. Not Skyzone levels at all. When I took my kids it was pretty empty (because I timed it well). I'd say this is better for younger kids.. think 10 and below. There was a good amount of trampolines for the size of the place. They had a small "arcade". To play you had to buy cards and points. The staff was barebones and Idk what their roles were. I'm guessing if you schedule a party there'd be food made because... there was no food ready to eat. I didn't have a problem with the music but, there were some songs that weren't clean. Lastly, if you know the Rodney Village Shopping Center, you should know what to expect.

data.address: 901 Governors Pl, Bear, DE 19701, United States
data.title: Fun City Trampoline Park

reviews.content: As a parent, I absolutely love bringing my kids here. I love how safe it feels I love how clean the environment is I love the seating available to parents and the clean restrooms. It’s super affordable and at tires my kids out we have visited multiple times and do frequent play dates with my kids and friends Plenty to do with not so much of a crowd. They also have an arcade which is a plus.
Not worth money

First of all the play area is awesome! But most importantly, especially to someone like me, they are absolutely wheelchair friendly. I was able to roll up to where the kids jump into soft squares. That was truly awesome cuz it allowed me to watch my son who was there for his 10th birthday and he was there for most of the time! I will absolutely take him there again on a regular day just bc of that! He loved it and he loved being able to have his mom watch him do backflips into the soft squares!

So what time when I went to this trampoline park park I thought it was gonna be so much fun, but it wasn’t be aware. I will never come to this place again. Because one time a 25-year-old woman went on the zip line and she jumped off of it. She broke the zip line and now no one could use it for the rest of the day some 22 year old were jumping on the jumpiest trampolines there were in that same exact Trampoline park and started doing backflips on it while two year-old went flying into the air. What the heck kicked these guys out bring back Ibp turn this back into a Kmart. I’ll never come here again. Be aware from this establishment and one time my cousins were going on the tubes and there were some rude people so my cousin said I’ll take the next one and the rude person said no I’ll take the next one because you guys took the last one. What the heck kick these guys out too and I heard a story about someone getting their foot caught in one of the things save someone and I almost drowned into the phone pit while some people were doing backflips off of one star never come here again Pizza is good though.

We had a birthday party here last weekend and it was perfect. The play area was clean and well kept. The party room was a great size, stocked with napkins, plates, and silverware. Pizza arrived right in the middle of the party which was great timing. I liked that we could bring our own food in (Philly pretzel company is across the street) instead of a generic kitchen making subpar food. Our attendant was great. We had a wonderful time and it was much better run than the competitors.

This establishment allowed an adult to throw a ball at my niece and hit her in the face because my niece was arguing with his child…. Then after admitting it, the management still refused to remove the adult. Had no empathy for my daughter and this grown man throwing a ball!
The best trampoline park we've been to, and we've been to all of them in the area 😅 …
The kids absolutely loved it. Great for all ages. There is a lot going on but it's was a good place tomburn energy.

I took my kids here for my daughter’s birthday. She has autism level 1 and this place was great. I was hesitant because of a lot of mixed reviews. But let👏me👏tell👏you…this place is great for sensory seekers. I think a lot of bad reviews just come from parents that are either not watching their kids or others that aren’t. My daughter has no sense of spatial awareness and no sense of danger and every parent I saw was doing what they were suppose to. Parenting their kids. The staff is kind and very willing to help. I had no idea what socks would fit my kids feet and the lady was on point with all three. Loved that. And they just kind of hang back unless you need something. Loved that too. I didn’t feel that constant pressure for following a million rules while trying to let my kids have fun.
I really enjoyed this place over past experiences at sky zone. We also went on a week night so it was pretty empty. Loved that also. It was a pretty penny I will say that. On our first go around for an hour and a half plus socks it was around $80. But I will say you get a lot of bang for your buck if your kids have as much energy as mine. The arcade is good too. My husband and son enjoyed it and you can win prizes and earn points for prizes. They have lockers for your shoes for $5. And my husband tried out the cotton candy machine and it makes these really cute designs. They also sell bagged snacks and drinks which is nice after running around. All in all I would recommend this place.

Nice place to get the kiddo out of the house for a couple hours. Not much attention from workers but they are teenagers so not much to expect from that. Thankfully I go everywhere my kid goes unlike some parents that let their kids run amok and jump into other kids or bully little kids.

First time was for a birthday party.  Great place for kids! Literally offers everything the other competitors offer and seems cleaner and safer - only one way in and out - which is nice for parents! Kids can run around and have fun- trampolines, bungee course, slides, ball pit, arcade, and more! Will definitely come back!
I just loved the place. It was so much fun for my toddler. I wish I could take my toddler there more..
It was me and family first time going to fun city by far one of the best ones we been to in a long time.The kids had fun we will definitely be going back.
I love it me and the whole family will go back been many times I have great an awesome time
We loved this place, better than others we have visited. My daughters were more than happy with the price. Accessible compared to Urb. Skz
It was a fun atmosphere
N/A

If you want your kids to play in a rough environment where there is no limit on how many kids will be in this place, this is the place to go. It is total mayhem in here. Within the first few minutes my kids got hurt. I guess that's why they make you sign the waiver. Some of the younger staff are horrible and rude. Tables started being removed before our time was up while the kids were still eating.

I like this place it's great but 2 bad things the summo arena they don't refill the air and the doge ball their is no reff but the rest Is great you can pipelines and stuff it like urban air and sky zone and its own stuff combined
It is amazing, fun stuff to do, clean, but some workers can be rude but it is still really fun
Park had great amenities but not as clean as other trampoline parks and quite expensive.
This place was beyond amazing the best jumping park in Delaware hands-down
Nice place for quick party

Kids had a blast. It was worth the money even for my fearless 2 yr old. However the ball pit has a sign 10 years and younger that is not monitored by staff. Teenagers were often rough housing in it the night we were there.   That age group has their own pit.  This is only reason I didn’t give 5 stars.
Great place for the kids.
Very disappointing. Looks like a very fun place. But the owner lacks empathy and reasoning
This place is amazing. For everything they have I feel like the price is good.
N/A
My Son loved this place
N/A

This past Saturday, my child visited and went to jump into the ball pit, which looks huge and deep but it’s not! She jumped in, landed on her foot, and broke it. She was given an ice pack and we were in and out of the facility within 20 minutes. Parents, please be aware that by signing the waiver, you give up the right to take legal action against this place. When I called to request a refund, given that we were there for only 20 minutes, I was offered one free pass to return. I will never bring my children back here.
They slept well this, night 💤🔥🙏🏾 …

My kids (12,8 &3) LOVE this place. It’s huge, we went at a less busy time right when they opened one day and the kids practically had the place to themselves - the staff are nice, let the kids be kids and intervene if needed and just lets the whole vibe of the place be safe fun. We like it. A tiny bit pricey but for everything included & how much the kids love it I’d be lying if I said we won’t be going back! Definitely recommend.
N/A
It’s really fun I would recommend going there
I love this place! Been going since opening and I take my baby cousins all the time and they love it! I highly recommend going with your family & friends!

Had my son’s 18th birthday party here and everyone had a great time! The lines were a bit long to check in for my party, but we had a host assigned to us and she did not disappoint! The only drawback is their table cloths and “party” plate/items weren’t festive at all, but it came with the package so it was great. We were also able to bring in food in addition to the great pizza that came with the package. Will be returning!

Review of a Weekday at Fun City

This place was great! I went here recently on a weekday to check the place out. The place is bigger than Urban air and has more things to do. The prices are expensive though. I hope they open a membership soon like Urban air has. The playground is gigantic and has lots of things to do but BEWARE that the ball pit isn’t deep at all so make sure your kids don’t try to jump into it. There were only a few people here so we basically had the whole place to ourselves. It’s a great place to bring KIDS EIGHT or older because the attractions there are designed more for older kids like a zip line that you have to hold onto(Don’t worry there is foam blocks underneath so you won’t fall),a ropes course, a diving pit and a Ninja course. The trampoline area was also probably the biggest trampoline area I’ve seen. BE CAREFUL if you have little kids that like to wander off or cause mischief because many of the attractions there aren’t being monitored by staff so little kids could get in places where they shouldn't. The park also had a bobsled kind of thing that was really fun to go on. But you have to carry the bobsled up the staircase so again, if YOU HAVE LITTLE KIDS, make sure that they don’t get hurt pulling it up. The place also had a dodgeball court that looked kind of small but I didn’t play in it so I don’t really know how it works. Overall this is a great place for older kids and we had a lot of fun here.
N/A

PARENTS BEWARE:
We drove an hour to bring my son here for his birthday. He was ecstatic and we had a great time for the first hour. My son got his foot stuck in one of the rope nets, no big deal, but he did need some help getting untangled. The woman that he asked for help, who we later confirmed is the manager, decided it would be appropriate to tell my 10 year old that what he “needed was more exercise”. Not only was this extremely unprofessional of a “child friendly” facility, but also ruined the whole experience for my son and his siblings who also heard this interaction. If I could give zero stars I would. To have this be the “highlight” he remembers from his birthday party is heartbreaking to me.

Me and my children had the time of our lives. It was so much fun . It was so much space for me and my 5 year old to play without feeling like we were all over top of each other. Lots to do!
Bring your own snacks, juice and water
Worth taking the children, reminds me of urban park. Atmosphere is a little bigger,the children love it 🥰 …
A kid fell from the Zipline tonight. Had to be taken away in a stretcher and wasn't moving. 1 Star feels like an appropriate rating...

We just visited today, and this place is awesome! As the parent who likes to play WITH my 10yo, we had a blast! Adults can do the rock walls, trampolines…the foam pits are DEEP, especially where the jumping platforms and trapeeze are- getting yourself OUT of the foam pits is a feat in and of itself!! The timed tickets are great bc it sets a limit for those who are ready to go after a couple of hours. The tickets also include EVERYTHING- rock climb, zip
lines, all of it- unlike other trampoline parks that charge extra for the extra fun stuff. The kids played hide and seek throughout the playground area and had a blast at that too. My only complaint would be that they do not have a food court- only vending machine type food- so camping out for the afternoon with a lunch break and more playtime isn’t an option (unless you purchase another timed pass) and hunger was a bit of an issue- but our time was up anyway so it all worked out. We’ll definitely be back!!

We decided to check this place out. So we picked up our 8 yr old grandson and our 12 yr old nephew and away we went. The boys had such a great time, and it was worth the price for their 2 hours of unlimited fun.
This is a must check it out location that I highly recommend.  Have fun!!

I have a five year old. This was her first time going and she had a ball. I think I’ll plan her birthday party for Hear this year because chunky cheese is really overdone. She’ll have a better time here I think.

I took my daughter but saw some safety concerns. They have an area with a blue slide and next to it is a red warp wall but kids kept trying to go down it like a slide and had to be told not to but there was no supervision there by staff members! they are still installing another slide next to those (purple) and its not ready yet but just blocked by caution tape that kids can easily ignore and get seriously hurt there! There should really be a barrier between the red and blue slide area so the top of the red cant be accessed by the climb through structure at all and there are stairs next to the purple one they are installing that can be used for the red warp wall if needed.  And all of that area is accessible from the climb thru structure. Plus that big ball pit area is only a foot deep so cant jump into it or will get hurt even just from the stairs into it. 🤦‍♀️

Went for a bday party. Great space. You can let your kids run around while you sit and relax at the picnic tables. Great time for all kids ages. Ball pit, trampolines, ropes course, slides, arcades. There are plenty of things to keep'em occupied for hours. Highly suggest.
Erickson was very helpful and great today!!! Kudos.!!!!!

I brought my daughter here to play today. She had a great time. In addition to the trampoline, there are many other interesting projects here. The staff are also very patient and responsible. When you are tired of playing, you can play game consoles in the game console area. My daughter is already looking forward to the next visit
Good place to go to
Came here with a few friends and this park did not disappoint. They have all kinds of activities, not just jumping. I had fun the whole time I was here.

At first I was like it's pricey, but later on I realized it's worth the price. My 2 year old had a blast. And not just her even my hubby who was with her. Lastly, my hubby lost his wallet but they helped him to secure it. It's really a good place to go with family. 🥰 …

I came in with my 5 and 2 year olds and I must say the place is impressive however there are few issues that I had with this place. First the price is outrages, I get they are big and have a lot of activities but they for and hour and half I spent $80 for just us three, they charge the parents the same as the child which is $26 for hour and half and for my 5 years old was also $26 my 2 year old was $18 for hour and half. Then everyone needed the socks which was 3.5 each. Going in they didn’t have enough staff for the size of the place and on a Saturday, I counted about 5 in total. Big kids and small kids were playing in the same areas, the play ground for toddlers is basically a maze trap, if your little ones don’t have you with them they will get overwhelmed and start cry or lost, I basically spent the whole time looking for my 5 year old. And my anxiety level was sky high. We left after 30 min. I wouldn’t recommend for kids 5 and under but it is a really awesome place for older kids for sure. Unfortunately excuse of the cost it wouldn’t be something you do on a regular basis, just too expensive and they don’t have any discounts or memberships. Hopefully they adjust.
It was really fun but these guys started to push me in this trouble there is no worker walking
N/A

We have been waiting for Fun City Adventure Park to open for months! And they finally opened! This is definitely  a go-to destination for families looking for a day full of fun and excitement! From its expansive trampoline zones to the thrilling obstacle courses, different arcade games, there’s something for kids of all ages. Both of my kids age 7 and 10 loved it so much and they can't wait to go back again! the price is very reasonable price and place is really well maintaicl too. Staffs here are very friendly and helpful too. We’ll be back for sure!

reviews.content: 10/10 fantastic day at the Delmar Littles Play café! Anna was amazing at helping me figure out what things I can have/not have from the drink bar because I have dye allergies. Everything was so clean and in such great condition!! Definately love this location!!!
N/A

Absolutely outstanding spot for the little ones. We attended a birthday party here and even our 5 month old was mesmerized. The staff are incredibly friendly and accommodating, the atmosphere is amazingly clean and inviting, food and drink are top notch, and everyone had a great time, parents included.
I brought my grandson here on a rainy day. This place is fun, safe and clean. I was able to sit while he used up all his energy. Will definitely come back when the weather is too hot to play outside.

I cannot say enough wonderful things about this place. My nephew absolutely loved it! For reference, he’s four years old and turning five in June, and it was just perfect for him. The whole space is incredibly clean, super interactive, and so much fun. Most importantly, it felt very safe—I could see him at all times, which really helped keep my anxiety at a low, low level. I truly loved everything about it. It’s beautiful, bright, and just so full of joy. I honestly think everyone needs to come and experience it for themselves!
For little ones, this place has all the fun stuff they love!
We stopped by this play cafe during our road trip through Albany and absolutely loved it! My daughter had so much fun, and the coffee was great too.

So much fun and the coffee is good too!
We love going to the Littles Play Cafes in Latham and Delmar for a playdate or just to work off some zoomies. So excited for the larger locations in Latham, Schenectady, and Clifton Park to open!

Love bringing my toddler here he always has such a great time. I do personally prefer the Latham location however this one is a very close second. Very clean, large play area. Clean restrooms. Lots of room for shoes. Only complaint is that most of the toys (shovels/buckets/etc.) in the sand pit were cracked or broken, definitely easy to get cut on.
Great place for kids of all ages and abilities!
Really nice spot to meet for playdates. I love the openess so you can see your kid at all time. Highly recommend
Great place! My 18 months kid loved it!
Kid loves it! Great new location and friendly staff.
Safe, enclosed, warm. Spent three hours here. Not bored. Was able to read and watch my kid.
Good

Perfect place for kids to release their energy. Every corner is child proof, no need to worry about children bumping into hard objects. Very clean as well. As alot of seats for parents to sit a relax!
Great little play area for toddlers.

Great spot for the kids!

We LOVE The Littles Play Cafe in Delmar.  The location is huge!!  I had really nice sidebar spaces where I could plug in while my 2 and 4-year-olds were playing!  Part of the reason I am so obsessed with the play cafe is because it is SO SAFE.  It's nearly impossible for my daredevil 2-year-old to get hurt.  My kids have so much fun!  They beg me to take them here every weekend, its so nice for them to be contained in a safe space and run and get all their giggles out.  There are different activities for different types of kids, and I have found this so accommodating.  My son is beyond active and wants to jump in the balls, climb, and go down the slide.  My daughter is quiet and reserved and loves the sand, books, and toy kitchen to play with.  This has also been a great spot for play dates and for my friends and me to enjoy any of the fun coffees or bubble teas while the kids are playing, having the time of their lives in a safe, contained space.  I seriously cannot recommend it enough! My kids have so much fun, and it is easy for me to relax, which is not usually the norm when taking my toddlers out.  We bought the class pack and that was more than worth it, especially with two kids.  The space is SO clean which is amazing!  The staff are constantly cleaning and sanitizing.  It makes me feel even more at ease.  There is nothing else quite like this in the Capital Region.  I cannot recommend it ENOUGH!!
So happy the Littles play cafe opened a second location! We love coming here because it’s clean, safe and fun for the kids. This is the best play area in Albany for kids under 7.
Such a fun place my kiddo loved it
N/A
My 4 year old absolutely loves this place. Very clean and safe. The area for parents is great.  The owners are fantastic.  Check it out .
Great smoothies!

The new location in Delmar is great! The play area is safe, spacious and colorful. My 18 month old loved climbing along the gym and jumping in the giant ball pit. The area outside of the play area is also perfect for adults to safely watch their children and hold a conversation with their fellow parents 😊 …

We have been going to the Littles Play Cafe since they first opened in Latham in 2023. We try and visit either location at least once a week since it's our boy's favorite place to play. Lu and Chen treat my children like family and they have helped plan (2) of our  son's birthday parties. This is a must go for people with small children.
