reviews.content: Has been the most rewarding 2 years of loving the service and space provided for my son who has ADHD. He has really grown in the space and helps with his socializing skills and playing with other kids. The care and attention provided by the staff have been the best thing to ease into the hour and half Sunday sessions that he has become super independent. Best birthday for small parties with staff being super attentive to each child's needs.

I’ve been going to this gym with my class for many years now and I cannot stop singing them non stop accolades!
My students are special need and they enjoy this experience to the max!  There’s so many equipment to go on that the children are non stop on the go with glee!
The staff is beyond friendly, caring, & super professional.  They interact and play with the children too!   The staff & owner are truly empathetic & understand the needs of our children.
They even make sensory glitter bottles with each child as well as part of their hands on activity.
The environment is safe & secure.  There is an inner gate as you enter the facility for added security to block any litte escape artist as well.

Cubbys are located right at the entrance to stash away lunch boxes, bags & shoes.  The kids and adults run wild in socks throughout the gym.  The experience is always a memorable one.  Another great year for us down in the books!
Great place. We were here yesterday and the baby loved it. The owner is a doll and staff member was so kind and helpful. We will be returning. Thank you for a wonderful experience. ❤️

Absolutely unacceptable behavior from the manager at Sensory Beans. I’ve been attending this location for 8 years and have never been treated so poorly. During a birthday party, we were abruptly told to “go to the back” with no context, no courtesy, not even a simple please. If this is how a manager speaks to loyal customers, she seriously needs to take a lesson—or several—on how to speak to people with basic human decency, let alone how to usher guests back to a party room kindly.

What made it worse was her smug, dismissive attitude. When I voiced my concern, her response was “I’m sorry you feel this way,” which is nothing more than condescending gaslighting. She repeatedly refused to offer any sort of real apology or take responsibility for her disrespectful tone. And to top it off, she wouldn’t even give her name. That says it all.

Funny enough, the younger volunteer workers were far more professional and respectful than the actual manager. If this is how management operates now, Sensory Beans has seriously lost its way. Do better.
N/A
It was a great place to take your children to unleash all that energy! It’s bit on the smaller side but the women working on site are great and very nice!
N/A

Couldn't make a open play i had booked so I called to cancel but they don't do refunds only send you codes you can use towards your next open play. I showed the young girl my email and how it showed they canceled my session n code only to have her tell me that it isn't coming up on their end. I'm standing there showing her exactly what they sent me stating it was canceled with no refund n code only to have her tell me again that there is nothing she can do about it cause it isn't coming up on her end.  The young girl went to call the owner and was on the phone for a while. When she came back she said the same thing. I asked her how I could go about speaking to the owner and if she had a phone number I could call but she said she couldn't give that out then I Asked for the owners name and she wouldn't even give me that. At one point the young girl said to me " Miss if this is gonna continue  I'm gonna have to ask you to leave" my tone was not loud and I even apologized to her for   taking up so much of her time and she is threatening to have me leave. So disappointed, the owner should of spoken with me, this is her place of business and she should of  handled  this situation in a more professional manner.  The young girl even admitted to me that my email did show everything, the code, the cancellation  but she couldnt do anything cause it wasnt coming up on their end. I'm just flabbergasted that the owner refused to speak with me. I wasn't yelling or acting out of sorts, just trying to understand  what was going on. I will never go there again.  Ended up taking the kids to childrens social club in rockville center after and they had a blast. The owner there is a gem. Just a tip for those who plan to visit sensory beans do not follow their clock on the wall as it is 10 mins ahead. I mentioned this to them several times and it still hasn't been fixed.
N/A

Omg had a terrific time with niece great  place especially  for children with Autism .very safe and well maintain place very clean . The staff was
amazing 👏 😍 thanks for the hour of fun . Will definitely  recommend 👌  will pay for more sessions for niece . …

I took my 4 year old grandson there and was very pleased with the whole experience. The play equipment was clean and there was a nice variety of things to do. There was one person behind the registration counter and another person who worked in the play area trying to engage the kids in play. You do need to supervise your own child to make sure she/he plays safely, which all parents/guardians were doing. There were several slides and several swings, tunnels, small stationery ride on and bouncy toys, and a foam pit. There was also many things to climb onto or under. There was also a small play kitchen area. The bathroom was roomy and clean with a pull down diaper changing station. I do see that the entry way where the cubbies were is a small area but when I went there were only about 6 children (and 6 adults) so this was not an issue. I can see how it would be extremely crowded if it was at full capacity, especially since this is the area where one has to take off shoes and put them back on after the play sessions is over.  I am a pediatric Occupational Therapist and thought the environment was great and safe for kids with special needs however; when I went, there were not a lot of children and adults. At full capacity it might be challenging to children with sensory issues. I will say that I thought it was a fun experience for my grandson.

This is not a place for kids with special needs as advertised. It is more of a place that people take their toddlers and little kids especially during the cold months to enjoy as a playground. Some of the staff are very nice but others leave much to be desired. There was one staff member that actually singled out my child for running around with another kid and made him sit in a separate room till he cooled down. Did not bother to address the fact that there were two kids running around. My son is autistic and was hyper aware of being singled out in a room full of adults and kids. Another time this same staff member put her hands on my son to "calm him down" and my son slapped her hand away. She proceeded to tell me to do something about it but my response is why are you touching my son when you do not even know what his special needs are and how he will react to being personally touched. Obviously my son read right through her supposed I mean well act and did not like her at all. That was the last time I went there. I do not recommend this place to anyone who has special needs kids especially ADHD, they are not very welcoming. More concerned about the babies and toddler around than providing a space with no judgement for special needs children.
Clean, friendly staff and great space! Had a birthday party there and it was perfect! 3 great party attendants included and fairly priced
Awesome!

The place is cute & fun for the kids to play at. We were greeted by a girl who was interacting with my children & ready to play with them.  I will start by saying that the price is $24 per child, no matter how many children you have there’s no ‘sibling discount’ so if you have 5 children you’re paying $120 for an hour and a half, which seems super pricey to me since you’re limited on time & things to do. Next thing that I really want to hit on is that when I came in I had my mom & children ( we were the only ones there and it was already 10 mins after the time frame started). My grandma decided she wanted to stay outside to get some air with her medical service dog (clearly labeled, tags & a plus- hypoallergenic). After being outside for a little while she wanted to come in. My mom said to one of the girls working ‘is it okay if I let my mom in with her service dog I will tell her to stand right at the entry way with her so she could still see the kids playing. ‘ the girl paused &  then went to the back room to ask the other worker if it was okay. She came back out, didn’t say anything at all and after two minutes we asked her what the answer was. She said ‘unfortunately no she can’t come in with the dog because it’s not big enough and people might have allergies sorry’ ok, understandable if it was just a random dog that wasn’t a registered service dog. Ok, whatever so we just say ok you can’t deny her because she’s a service animal and she’s like ok I’ll go back and ask again , at that point it was just fine & my grandma went and sat in the car not causing a stink. So after about 2 minutes from here she said oh you can take the baby out of his car seat and go walk around by the kids if you want. I said oh no it’s okay he’s sleeping now they’re having so much fun together. She’s like oh okay. So then I was wondering, “am I supposed to be standing with all of my children playing with them?” She said “Yeah you’re supposed to be, but since it’s not that busy it’s okay.” I have never been to a play space where my children were the only ones there within my eyesight where I had to be up their butt watching them every move aside from the couple times I went to help them. So again, put off a little bit by basically being told I needed to play with them when the girl who let us in was playing with them at first I though that was the idea of the gym.
Overall it’s a cute idea, definitely over priced for a short time &  there are a few blurred lines as to what is supposed to go on inside the gym area

The owner Rachel is absolutely obnoxious, nasty and repugnant. She is extremely disrespectful and stomach-churning. She not only yells at the parents and her staff…but she does it in front of the children. She is completely unprofessional and unhinged. It’s quite concerning. Not only that, the place is dirty. I don’t know when they clean, but it’s completely unsanitary to have children play in that type of environment. Open play time is supposed to be 90 min. Well before the 90 minutes is up; I noticed some of the staff rushing the kids to hurry up because they wanted to set certain areas back up for the next group. I saw other parents complaining as well. You would think the staff would be warm and bubbly in a place like this, especially the owner, Rachel. We will never be coming back here and for good reason. Just terrible!
Took my toddlers here and they loved it. Place is clean and staff is helpful and keep the place tidy. Will be returning !
very cute I liked it a lot 👍 …

Book in advance. Clean place to play. Variety of climbing frames and small ballpit like area, pretend kitchen, sensory board and back room with games for lils. Follow @exponentialexperiences on IG for more reviews for places and tips

my 20 month son love this place.    He likes everything in there . I have to mention that he love the staffs attention as well. the girls are nice.
bathroom is clean.

Nathan had a great 4th birthday party.. The staff was wonderful , Very impressive young ladies. can't wait to bring my little guy back to play!  I thought the 1hour 1/2 party was going to be too short but it was actually perfect the kids had a good hour of active play .. then a half hour for food and cupcakes.   They were all happy & exhausted
My grandson has so much fun. The girls are so hands on as well. We will return as much as possible .
We came here for a play date last week and my son had a blast !!!!!! we will definitely be back!!
Very small, and equipment is worn and outdated.
Great place lots to do . I bring my toddler all the time that I watch . Clean and nice people
N/A

Cute place but the staff is overwhelming. They are constantly right next to you, basically snatching toys from your kids hand so they can clean it up. Also, they have two bathrooms and only let you use one, which is kind of inconvenient when it’s a packed class of 19 kids and adults.

Just had our sons birthday party here this afternoon and the staff working the party couldn’t have been nicer or more helpful.  We didn’t have to lift a finger.  Most stress free party we have ever hosted.  They made sure the kids had fun, took photos for us, made sure kids and adults were all fed, packed up the leftovers and even helped carry gifts to the car.  The best part, our little guy had a blast at his third birthday party.
N/A
Went to a birthday party for a 3 year old and had a great time. Lots of activities for small children with different levels of difficulty. Staff is awesome, highly recommended!
N/A
Needs more space.
Went to a 2 year old birthday here, and it was very fun! We could have played a lot longer with everything they had!
N/A
Very nice for the kids!
Nice local place for the kids to play, my son always has fun
Always fun with my daughter
My daughter had lots of fun an hour and half for the first time.  Clean place and friendly staff.

Brought my 2yo son, who had the time of his life. It's a bit smaller compared to other play places I've been to, but definitely not any less fun. They have a "game" room which seems to double as a party room in the back. My parents also came and were able to sit comfortably while watching my son play. Cost only $18 for 1.5 hours of open play. Definitely recommended for younger children, although probably too small and repetitive for older children.
My daughter loves going and the staff is so great and helpful.
N/A

The space was very small, I don't deny that my daughter enjoyed it... but the Asian girl who was in charge that day is not friendly to that environment, she caught my attention because my Autistic daughter took off her socks, however other children were without socks and she never said anything to them... of the group of parents who were there we were the only Latinos, I don't know if that has anything to do with it, but I don't think I'll go back 🙁 on top of that I was holding up some toys for my daughter to look at and try to do and she told me that there were I'll leave it, before you go, don't look at the reviews and they aren't that good.

We passed by sensory beans last week and decided to stop in, and I’m so glad we did. My son is 5 and my daughter is 1, and the space was a perfect place for them to play. It had a small climbing area/ slides that was perfect for my toddler, swings, and a lot of different sensory toys that was amazing for my 5 year old. I am definitely going back and I highly recommend!!

Definitely a fun place worth trying out. My daughter enjoyed it. But I really wish that they could have different time slots for different age groups. It was a little chaotic having 8 year olds zooming past my 19 month old.
N/A

I really wish I didn’t have to be posting this. Sensory beans was always a fun safe space for my autistic son, and his big sister. This happened a few months ago and I planned on never sharing because I didn’t want to ruin one’s reputation, but the same thing has happened multiple times. The owner is extremely unprofessional and rude. This is NOT the attitude for this environment, especially when dealing with our babies with sensory issues. The staff here is caring and incredible, much more professional than the manager. I have witnessed the manager talk so rudely to her employees, which breaks my heart because they’re always the ones who make my son smile. I saw and witnessed her yelling at one girl for something that happened that was completely out of control. She looked like she was about to burst into tears. I have seen multiple reviews about the owners behavior specifically. It breaks my heart, but after two years of attending we will not be returning.

This is a fun, interactive place for young children. That said, they are unreasonably stringent with the time restrictions. If you show up even a minute early, they will keep the doors locked and refuse to let you inside until it’s your appointment time. I went on a day when it was pouring outside and they had parents with infants and toddlers wait outside in the rain until it was exactly 4pm. There were no other children inside at that time so it wasn’t due to spacing or safety issues. Most indoor play spaces will let you in or allow you to wait in the waiting area if you come early. They do have a waiting area so it’s ridiculous that they won’t let you in if you’re just a few minutes early. Considering there are so many new indoor play spaces now, they should show a little kindness and courtesy towards customers if they want people to come back.
Nice place but the party was really quick. Felt rushed.

We tried this place for our first time and were very disappointed. The place was poorly lit and not great air flow. Other toddler play places are way cleaner, lit up, colorful and a place to feed/snack your toddler. The set up of this gym is not functional at all and everyone is on top of eachother. The young staff is not attentive either. Will not be back and will not recommend.

We attended a private bday party. Staff was great, very attentive to all the guests and professional. However my son had stomach issues after eating the pizza. It was not warm at all. I noticed too that my slice was pretty cold. Maybe timing the food delivery better so it’s warm would be good. Great place for little ones :)
Nice and clean sensory gym for my kids.  So nice to not need masks in the gym.

My two year old was invited for a birthday party here at sensory beans a couple weeks ago… I have to say he had the best time ever! Being able to run around so free not hearing mommy or daddy or older sister or older brother saying “no!” Or “stop it!” Or “get off of that”!… Just being able to bounce around on everything  padded without resistance from anyone or anything!! he had such a great time at the party, but I decided to look into it and see how much it would cost for him to go to a session of “open mat“ to my surprise it was not expensive at all. For $17 for an hour and a half of free play, it’s actually every mother‘s best hidden secret lol it gets them super tired all that bottled up energy out… And they have so much fun here! I say that this place is actually the perfect place for ages 1 1/2 to 4 1/2-five years old… It allows them at this sensitive age to be free and explore without a mom being worried that they’re going to hurt themselves in the process. The staff is super friendly, they’re so great with the kids, even with the moms… Their mats are sprayed and Lysol’d and disinfected between every session… I highly recommend sensory beans to any mother looking to find that nice clean safe place for their child to go and enjoy yourselves… nothing is better than having a place your child always looks forward to being at and at the end of the day will help them sleep happily at night lol. Go check it out for yourself, me and my son will be there, more than likely, when you get there 😉

I took my daughter there for a play date with their friends. The staff's attention was great and their service was very efficient and sweet with the kids. They even played with the girls and helped them when we weren't next to them. The place is impeccably clean (we went first thing in the morning), and for the price, there are a lot more options and space than I thought there would be. I would recommend it for kids between 0-5 years old.
Brought my 1 year old son and he loved it. Great place to play indoors.
N/A

I genuinely wish I did not have to write this review, because this place has such a great concept. I have visited Sensory Beans with my son on multiple occasions, however, recent interactions with the owner yesterday upset me so much that we will no longer be returning.

I witnessed multiple moms being spoken to in a condescending, inappropriate way. There was absolutely zero need to treat another human being the way my friend was treated yesterday. It was quite frankly appalling, and it makes me incredibly upset that her *daughter* of all people had to witness this.

In addition to the owner's attitude, Sensory Beans does not have ample space for guest belongings/check in/departure. As a result, while attending a St. Patrick's Day event, everyone was attempting to leave at the same time when the party ended. As a mother with a toddler, I chose to stand out of the way of the cubbies to feed my child a snack by the door, along with a few other moms and their kids. There was physically no room to get our things by the cubbies due to the poor design of the space, so in order to prevent our toddlers from heading back into the play area to run around and possibly prevent clean up for the next event, we chose snack time as a distraction. We were repeatedly (unkindly) asked to move and get our things, which was physically impossible due to the lack of space.

I also witnessed the owner scolding another mother of two while she was in the cubby area in the middle of strapping her daughter into her car seat. Yes, she was taking up space, but when you don't plan your business to have ample amount of space for your guests to arrive and depart, that is your own fault. This mother was not doing anything wrong, and handled the situation with so much grace.

For a place designed for kids with special needs, I'm shocked at the owners apparent disregard and lack of planning for something as universally challenging as transition times. I'm also surprised that this space doesn't have any areas where children can escape from the excessive stimulation. They could have used some inspiration from the sensory gyms in Roslyn Public Schools.

I'm sad that we will no longer be attending open play sessions here, as my son really did enjoy it. The staff, aside from the owner, was always great with the children and genuinely seemed to enjoy working with the kids. Perhaps the owner should take a cue from her younger staff, who seem to understand how to interact with the public much better than she does.

As disappointing as this experience was, I am comforted by the fact that Long Island has so many indoor play places for this age group, with more on the way. Hopefully someone reading this review will take my experience into consideration when designing their own space, and learn from Sensory Beans' mistakes.
Owner is rude. Not worth it

I went to Sensory Beans along with a group of moms and our toddlers today- we were treated with incredible disrespect by the owner and one mom of our group was obviously singled out. We will never return after the treatment we received.
And, the toys ans equipment were obviously not cleaned from the previous day. Steer clear!

I've been there twice with my littles. Both times have been a great experience. They have such fun staff who are interactive with the kids and play/do crafts with them. They have slides, climbing area, foam pit, ect. The place is small, which is perfect. You can see your kid from pretty much everywhere and its not overwhelming. reviews.content: WOW! We’ve always loved coming to Sippy Cups Cafe for open play — it’s such a fun and welcoming space — but hosting a birthday party here was truly next level. 10/10 experience! Everything was absolutely perfect, from the incredibly kind and helpful staff to the out-of-this-world cupcakes they provided. I didn’t have to stress about a single thing. Danielle and her team went above and beyond to make the day special. Highly, highly recommend for parties or play — they really outdo themselves!

We recently visited this children’s play café, and while the overall concept and space are very nice, there are a few things that could use some attention. The café itself is on the smaller side, and it definitely gets crowded quickly, especially during peak times.

My kids had a great time and enjoyed the different play areas, which is always the most important part. However, as a parent, I couldn’t help but notice that the space could benefit from some updates. A lot of the toys seemed worn out, and several pieces were missing. The play mats were heavily dirty and worn out, and the floors didn’t appear to be cleaned very well, which was a bit concerning.

With a little bit of TLC—like deeper cleaning, some fresh equipment, and regular maintenance—this place could be truly great. The potential is definitely there, and again, my children did enjoy themselves. I just hope the owners consider making a few improvements to enhance the experience for both kids and parents.

They do such an amazing job! We had our youngest daughter’s birthday party there and she and her friends had so much fun!!! Thank you to the wonderful staff! Miss Camryn was so good with the littles! Thank you so much!

reviews.content: Nice wooden box indoor playsets and paint activities and Lego table!!

Imaginarium has been such a foundational part of our homeschool story. In the early days when I wasn’t sure I could do this, the support I found here reminded me that I wasn’t alone.

It’s more than a program—it’s a safe space. You know your kids are truly seen here. The staff care deeply, everything is clean and thoughtful, and most of all, they get to know you. Your family becomes part of the community, not just another name on a list.

From the workshops and enrichment classes to the unforgettable events like LEGO Night, the Living History Museum, and that emotional moment watching our oldest graduate from kindergarten, Imaginarium has helped us shape a learning journey full of joy, confidence, and connection.

My son goes to the enrichment classes and has for two years. The staff and teachers have been incredibly kind and accommodating every week, even when he's not fun to deal with. It's either always clean and organized or staff are diligently working to ensure it is. It's hard finding spaces so welcoming with endless activities and I'm incredibly thankful we found The Imaginarium.

We love Imaginarium! We’ve gone here countless times since they have opened. Everyone is friendly, the space is clean, unique, and organized. My kiddos love the toys and the one of a kind play equipment that is provided. We’ve gone to almost every event they have hosted. We go to the Open Play which the kids love and so do I, because on occasion I’ll bring work to get done. The kids stay entertained the entire time we are there! We’ve had a birthday party there, which was hands down incredible. We’ve done the Kids Night Out events, we love that we can trust the staff and our kids feel safe. Recently, we did Meet & Greet with Santa and I don’t think we’ll ever go anywhere else to see Santa again. It was affordable, enjoyable, and above all expectations. We are so lucky to have this incredible business in our community!

i’ve been here two times with my three year old and he’s gotten horribly sick after each visit. got there right as they place opened for the day and definitely hadn’t been cleaned or picked up before opening either time.

My kids have been going here 2 years now as homeschoolers and we love it. The teachers are amazing, the other family's are welcoming and Lenae, the owner,  puts on so many different activities for the kids so they don't feel like they are losing out on what traditional school offers. They have classroom learning, structured gym, free play, holiday parties, school pictures, workshops and even dances plus more.

We even had a family emergency last year and Lenae worked with us to ensure my kids didn't lose their place after taking off "school" for over 2 months. This place was such a blessing to find. I would highly recommend checking them out.

A giant shout out too the Imaginarium staff who worked my daughters party you were a blessing !! And too anyone reading reviews debating on a party here BOOK IT !! My daughter’s 5th birthday was perfect today so much less stressful thanks to them doing all the set up which was PERFECT! I truly cannot thank the Imaginarium enough yall create magic when it comes to birthdays!!!

A wonderful space to have a child’s birthday party! The dining area is spacious — has a wall dedicated for backdrop displays with hooks already installed to hang banners and other decorations, and the play area will keep your kiddo and their friends entertained the entire event. The staff here is great and they have several party packages and decorative add on options to choose from. Highly recommend Imaginarium!
My toddler LOVES this place :)
Thank you so much for your 5 star review!
My daughter had such a great time at the Imaginarium! The staff was extra attentive and went above and beyond with her. Can't wait to go back!
Always fun. I would recommend to arrive around 10:45 as that is when it seems to get busier.
My daughter loves it
N/A

The owner is AMAZING and clearly does so much to ensure a fun, clean and energetic environment.  Small businesses are not easy to run, but this fun place is amazing and offers so much for the kiddos.  Thank you and we will be coming back here soon!!
Excellent indoor playground and great staff. Great value. Will be trying out one of their wonderful birthday packages.
N/A

Major bonus Aunt points!!!! I had my nephew who’s 3 for a few days and we went on a play date here and let me tell you. This was one of the best experiences. Ever. From the time we walked in the staff was so kind and friendly and once the door opened to the play area yeah that’s all it took. His face lite up like a Christmas tree. He definitely did not want to leave. Thank you for such a wonderful experience!!!!!

We had my sons birthday party here and loves it!
The staff was very attentive and friendly. Definitely made it easier for this momma. Thank you Imaginarium for such a wonderful memory.
Great place for kids Birthday party
Thank you so much for your review, Tiffany!
This was our first time. Our 2 year old granddaughter loved it. She played for 3 straight hours.
Thank  you so much for your 5 star review!

We absolutely love everything Imaginarium! We are members of their homeschool community, love all the special events they host, & open play when we need an indoor place space that is not the living room. The staff is AMAZING and the facility is awesome!
10/5 stars! 🥰
Nice indoor play area for the younger kids. Perfect for 5 and under. I was expecting a little more for the kids to have to play with.
Thanks so much for your 5 star review, Kirstyn!
Thank you so much for your 5 star review, Durielle!
The kids had a great time.
Thank you so much for your 5 star review!

My family has been customers of Imaginarium
since they opened. This place is top notch.
The owners are amazingly caring people and it shows through their business. It is a super clean, fun and safe place to spend an afternoon or morning with your kiddos. We have had several birthday parties here and attended several events and they are all run so smooth and are so much fun! I can’t recommend this place enough!

Love love love this place. There’s no other place like it in the area. SUPER CLEAN, has a space for kids of ALL AGES. The owner is especially kind and truly is an inspiration. The kids in this county deserve a place like this to go and express themselves. My daughter will be taking the homeschool enrichment program. My whole family loves this business. ❤️

Imaginarium is an absolute gem in Southern Maryland! As a parent, I couldn't have asked for a better indoor play space for my kids. The thoughtful design truly shines through – it's evident that every corner has been crafted with love and care. The highlight was the impressive Pirate Ship and Castle playground. Will be back!

As of now, this place has 101 reviews since the company opened. 10 of these "reviews" were within the past 9 hours, just today... stating how "clean" the facility is. #redflag This place was NOT clean. It's insane the owner is probably getting people to leave positive reviews when parents are being honest about how yucky this place is. It's a place for small children. It should be sanitary. :( Overall just sad.
EDIT: I visited Imaginarium with my wife on Saturday. We took our 1yo daughter. My wife left a review, now so am I. Yes, I am a family member of a previous reviewer... but I also was a paying customer.

We can’t get enough of everything Imaginarium has to offer! Great place for kiddos of ALL AGES! You can take your young ones, and let your elementary age kiddos play at the same time! We really love the Homeschool Enrichment choices, and free coffee 🥰 What really tops it off is how quickly the staff cleans and attends to all the children playing, my daughter loves everyone there.
Every time we visit the staff is always so friendly and the facility is always super clean! We love Imaginarium!

I’m a business owner and provide displays for Imaginarium Play. The center is always clean, and I’m always greeted with a smile by the staff when I come. The owner is very professional and you can tell works very hard to ensure a safe and clean  environment and for families.

I’d you desire a safe place for your children to explore, play and be creative.. this is it! Even better is the area for parents. I come here regularly and work while my children play. It’s such a friendly, clean and inviting environment.

I liked the place so much that I now teach there in their homeschool program too! The owner provides ample opportunities for the children of our community from play, tutoring, birthday parties, and a complete homeschool enrichment program.

I have been present for clean up time between open play and homeschool classes and I have been present for after hours clean up. The team does a great job and cares about your children’s time there to be in a clean environment. The team worked together to get a good sanitize down before the next group of kids came in and end of day clean up is always a good deep clean.

Last thing to point out is the pirates cove! My kids love the art supplies provided, the crafts available and all the items in the shop up front.

Overall cannot say enough about the Imaginarium! The place has become a staple in my children’s (and my own!) lives 💗

Imaginarium has been a staple for our family. The kid's night out program was the first place my children felt comfortable attending on their own, which led to them attending camp, laser tag, and other events offered. They look forward to their visits. The staff is incredible, they are kind and attentive. The facilities are very clean. The atmosphere is warm and welcoming every time we walk through the doors, which is quite often. We highly, highly recommend!

I’ve taken my children here several times when visiting the area. This facility is incredibly clean and fun. I’ve seen employees wiping down surfaces everywhere. The staff is very friendly, the equipment is unique and fun, and my children loved it!

My boys absolutely love the Imaginarium, I have enjoyed watching my daughter flourish and crawl here. She refuse to crawl at home but would whenever I took her to the Imaginarium. It is nice to know that I can let her explore in a clean and safe space.

Imaginarium is one of my favorite places in Calvert! I feel so comfortable letting my niece and nephew play here. Kids are able to express themselves and make friends, while they also get to play on different structures and equipment. Also, the facility is SUPER clean for being a children’s playground, the staff even goes around every so often (I’d say every 10 minutes) to wipe all toys and play structures down after children play with them. The bathrooms have CLEAN changing tables, and the snack area has complimentary tea and coffee! Love it!!
Did I mention the staff is very attentive and helpful? They will assure everyone is safe.
They have a few different play structures with different surprises inside each one, kitchen, dinos, trains, and more. There is even air hockey, building blocks, and crafts for the older kiddos to do if they tag along. I just can’t wait to watch Imaginarium grow and see what other cool stuff they have to offer in the future. This place is awesome!!! 10/10 Recommend!

Great place but they need to take the money they are making and clean and sanitize this place. It smells like feet as soon as you walk in. The toys are filthy and if you look around it seems nothing has been cleaned in years. I have been to this facility many times and never have seen any of the staff cleaning. The next time I go I will gladly take pictures to provide proof.

We love Imaginarium for many reasons, the first being the space is big enough for kids to run around and make friends, but not too large where I feel the need to know exactly where they are at all times while playing. I'm able to relax because I know they are playing in a safe place. It's not filled with loud bounce houses and music like a couple of the other indoor playgrounds we have visited within the state. They do sometimes have music playing, but families don't have to shout over it to be heard.

The staff are friendly folk, it's affordable, you can bring food in and sit in the seating area (sans peanut products), its not overstimulating, and it's just a gem of a place to have local to us in SOMD.

I took my 20 month old daughter to Imaginarium today, and I was really disappointed. First, it was FILTHY. The toys were NOT clean at all, the wall decor and houses were covered in thick dust like they hadn't been cleaned since they opened, the equipment was covered in months worth of dirty handprints. At one point, my daughter was playing in the blue foam blocks and picked up a huge ball of hair. Disgusting. I get that children aren't always the cleanest little people, but for that reason they should have a daily cleaning crew. Clearly they do NOT. Secondly,  the rules state socks must be worn... but kids were barefoot. I get it's summer but kids are climbing all over the place... where sweaty feet are. Finally, there needs to be an age/height limit. There were huge kids like 6-7 yos running around, rough-housing, putting the littles at risk of getting run over and hurt. I thought this place was exclusively for younger children ( < 5) but I guess not. I really wanted to like this place because it has great potential.  It is a great idea and has a lil lounge and store... but I cannot get fast how gross it was. I should have taken more pictures but I was too busy making sure my daughter wouldn't get run over by the big kids. :/ Sadly, I won't be taking my kiddo back.
Thank you so much for your 5 star review!

Great little indoor play place. There is a section open for you to eat at if bring lunch (or heat something in the microwave), and multiple wooden toys for the kids to play in/on.
I’m glad this is here. It gave us something to do on a rainy day.

Nice space for the children to run around but not enough time in between parties to get setup and for them to disinfect play area.  One party leaving another coming in and for the price you should get more than 2 hrs. A little pricey for 2hrs.

Art clubs, Kids Night Out, themed events, Homeschool play meet ups, homeschool “parties”/events, private parties, open play hours, honestly there isn’t much this place doesn’t do. Throughout our time here, I have leaned on this place to help my kiddo grow in a safe and imaginative environment and I have never been disappointed. The play structures are incredibly intricate and promote imagination that I know many kids are losing sight off with the new age of electronics. I love the staff here. They are sincerely caring, helpful, and attentive. There is not much for kids to do in this area and this place has been an addition that enhances the community tremendously. The prices are also phenomenal. While the cost of everything is on the rise, the pricing here has been consistent without sacrificing value. I also love that the owner will utilize and promote other products of small businesses! Thank y’all for everything you have done for my family and we will miss this place when we leave.

There are frequently age appropriate events and the staff very deliberately cultivates each one to ensure the highest quality possible. A must-go location if you are in southern Maryland and have kids.

Thank you for your review!

What an incredible party we had here. The entire process of scheduling, planning and getting there was so easy! You owe it to yourself to bring your littles to this wonderful place. So much space inside, such fun things to do and it was so clean! The staff was so friendly, professional and helpful! This place felt “safe” and that is a huge deal, especially in this day and age.

I really wanted to love this place, but it was underwhelming. IMO the price is a little too steep for what you get.

The play structures are super cool. I loved the art section and the reading nook, but there’s so much unrealized potential.

There are little toys scattered throughout like legos, train sets, magna tiles, and play food, but it’s such a mess. We couldn’t play with some of them because they were missing pieces, or didn’t seem to actually go together. I get it, tons of kids come every day, but there are so many organizational options that could be used to actually encourage play and imagination, like the name says.

The art section was super cute, but again, underwhelming. The only things available were construction paper, a few random crayons and colored pencils, dried out markers with mixed tops, scissors, and chalk. There are so many ways to make this more exciting and organized. Especially since we paid to play here.

The reading nook is a great concept, but it’s right next to the giant castle/ship structure, so it doesn’t really lend itself to reading. There was a cool, giant bear, but that got put away because someone used it as a landing pad for the slide. The books seemed pretty random and old. Everything in this place could be so much more!

I was also disappointed in kid behavior. I know there’s not much employees may be able to do, but it’s dangerous. Kids throwing things and roughhousing on top of two-story structures shouldn’t be acceptable when people are paying money to play here.

In all honesty, I feel like I just took my kids to an indoor playground and paid $22 for it. I don’t think it’s worth it. It could be in the future, but it’s not right now.
